intro: Allophylus mayimbensis, commonly known as the Mayimbé Allophylus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
